ovdesc.p: The TELLER.PASSBOOK file allows you to define the format of the data output on a savings account passbook. There is one record allowed in this file, "SYSTEM".
You can define the data to be output when:
a) A new passbook is issued. Eg The customer's name & address.
b) A new page is printed. Eg The balance brought forward.
c) An entry is printed. Ie The transaction amount, debit/credit column, balance etc.
d) The last line of the page is printed. Eg The balance carried forward.
e) The last page of the passbook is printed. Eg New book issued message.
The data printed can be any field from the following files:
ACCOUNT CUSTOMER COMPANY TRANSACTION CURRENCY ACCOUNT.STATEMENT STMT.ENTRY CATEGORY DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER
Any free format text or one of the following:
CREDIT +ve amount from the entry DEBIT -ve amount from the entry BALANCE the new account balance TODAY todays date TELLER.ID the current teller id.

The remainder of the information in TELLER.PASSBOOK specifies the physical characteristics of the passbook itself. Ie the first physical line to print entries, the size of the spine, the number of pages in the passbook etc.
Example
Field Column Format Print On

2. 1 ACCOUNT>ACCOUNT.NUMBER 42,2 16R NEW 2. 2 CATEGORY>SHORT.NAME 38,5 15L NEW 2. 3 DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER>AREA 12,6 35L NEW 2. 4 CUSTOMER>SHORT.NAME 17,10 35L NEW 2. 5 CUSTOMER>BIRTH.INCORP.DATE 17,12 4L NEW 2. 6 " " 1,35 1L NEW
2. 7 STMT.ENTRY>BOOKING.DATE 4,7 DATE FIRST 2. 8 "BF" 13,7 2L FIRST 2. 9 BALANCE 41,7 11*RX, FIRST 2.10 TELLER.ID 53,7 4R FIRST
2.11 STMT.ENTRY>BOOKING.DATE 4 DATE LINE 2.12 TRANSACTION>SHORT.DESC 13 2L LINE 2.13 DEBIT 16 11RX,N LINE 2.14 CREDIT 28 11RX, LINE 2.15 BALANCE 41 11*RX, LINE 2.16 TELLER.ID 53 4R LINE
6 FIRST.DETAIL.LINE 8 7 LAST.DETAIL.LINE 35 8 NUMBER.OF.PAGES 6 9 SPINE.LINES 20-22 10 ATTRIBUTE INIT

The "NEW" parameters print the customers name, account number, year of birth etc when a passbook is issued. The line parameter in the column field (column,line) forces the print to take place at the specific physical line rather than printing at the 'current' line. The " " printed at the last detail line forces a new page to be started, ready for the entries to be printed.

The "FIRST" parameters print the balance carried forward details at the start of each page. The balance and the booking date are taken from the ACCOUNT.STATEMENT record and the last statement entry respectively. Note: The format of the balance field, "11*RX,", means the amount will be printed with leading asterix with the X being replaced by the number of decimal places for the account's currency, ie: **11,056.78 or ******56.43

The "LINE" parameters print the details of each entry. Note: Thecolumn field does not contain a line specification, hence, the data will be output on the current line. If the entry is a deposit then the CREDIT field will contain the amount, otherwise the amount will be held in the DEBIT field. For DEBIT the negative sign is removed before printing using the "N" in the format specification, (11RX,N).
The output will look like the following:
Passbook Lines

All of the line specifications within the TELLER.PASSBOOK record, SYSTEM, refer to the PHYSICAL lines in the passbook. This is not the same as the entry number or passbook line. In the previous example the last detail line is 35, the first detail line (where to start printing entries) is line 8 with a spine of 3 lines at line 20 to 22.
It looks like this:

The numbers, down the left hand side, refer to the passbook line which will be entered by the teller when he wishes to change the current line to start printing. It is this passbook line which is stored on the ACCOUNT.STATEMENT record.

In summary, TELLER.PASSBOOK, requires the physical dimensions of the passbook in order to accurately position the print head for printing. The teller will refer only to the passbook line or entry number and the physical line is calculated automatically based on the these dimensions.

desc.p: Specifies the format of the output.
The following format specifications are normally used:

tr.td: number using the mask from the COMPANY record

Only one passbook format is currently supported, which is specified in the record SYSTEM.

From 14.2.00 release - the id of the teller passbook is enhanced to accept other than SYSTEM as its id. The implication is that there can be more than one type of lay out to the teller passbook from release 14.2.00

Fro any account if pass. book field is yes the id would by default be "System" unless the field in account. statement i.e. passbook. id is input with any other id. The other validations remain the same.
SYSTEM
from 14.2.00 other than System is also accepted.
This field reserved for future use.
The number of pages in the passbook - including any 'header' page where the customer's name etc is printed.

When this is exceeded then any "END" items are printed, a new passbook is issued "NEW" and the balance carried forward is printed "FIRST". Note: This occurs when the last entry is printed. Which means that a new passbook is issued when the current one is full & NOT when a new entry needs to be printed.
1-3 Numeric characters.
This field reserved for future use.
The physical line positions of the spine of the passbook where entries cannot be printed.
Identifies the middle of the passbook where entries cannot be printed. This is only required for passbooks printed with the spine running horizontally rather than the vertically.
The format is XX-YY where XX is the line number where the spine area begins and YY the end. Eg 20-22 would mean that entries should not be printed on lines 20,21 or 22.
5 Alphanumeric characters in the format XX-YY.
The physical line where the first entry, on a page, should be printed.

To determine this it is best to print data, outside T24, on every physical line of the passbook. You can then check not only which line to start the entries on but also whether the data is output on the pre-printed lines. It is likely that you will have to modify the line spacing, best handled by ATTRIBUTEs, in order to marry the two exactly.
The balance brought forward line is normally printed on the line preceding the FIRST.DETAIL.LINE.
1-3 Numeric characters.
Specifies the field to be printed.
The data printed can be any field from the following files:
ACCOUNT CUSTOMER COMPANY TRANSACTION CURRENCY ACCOUNT.STATEMENT STMT.ENTRY CATEGORY DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER
The TRANSACTION and STMT.ENTRY files contain details concerning the 'current' entry. The other files contain static information concerning the customer and account.
The special fields are as follows:
CREDIT +ve amount from the entry DEBIT -ve amount from the entry BALANCE the new account balance TODAY todays date TELLER.ID the current teller id.
Free format text can also be entered enclosed in double quotes, "xxxxx".

1-40 Any character a) FILE.NAME>FIELD.NAME b) "text" c) Special field. (i FILE.NAME>FIELD.NAME Must be one of the files listed above and the field must be a valid data field defined on the file's STANDARD.SELECTION record.
Special Field Must be one of the field names listed above.
In order that the Passbook printing can be in a standard language, and not complicated by the User or Customer having a different language, this field allows the setting of a standard default.
Setting the language here will ensure that the printing is done in one language and any amounts formatted in the correct manner.
Must be a record on the LANGUAGE file.

This field reserved for future use.
Internal field
The last phyical line, of the page, to print an entry.
When an entry is printed on this line it will cause one or all of the following:
LAST Data to be output at the end of a page. FIRST A new passbook page to be started. END Data to be output at the end of the book. NEW A new passbook to be issued.
1-3 Numeric characters
Determines when the data, specified by FIELD, COLUMN & FORMAT, should be printed.
Controls the output of the data. Depending on the code entered the data will be printed when:
NEW A new passbook is issued. Eg The customer's name & address.
NEW1 Additional details that can be printed on page 2 when a new passbook issued.
FIRST A new page is printed. Eg The balance brought forward.
LINE An entry is printed. Ie The transaction amount, debit/credit column, balance etc.
LAST The last line of the page is printed. Eg The balance carried forward.
END The last page of the passbook is printed. Eg New book issued message.
1-5 Alpha characters NEW, FIRST, LINE, LAST, END
This field reserved for future use.
Defines the printer attributes which should be downloaded to the passbook printer prior to printing entries.
This field will form a key to the PRINTER.ATTRIBUTE file based on the PASSBOOK.DEVICE defined on the TELLER.ID file. The key is 'PASSBOOK.DEVICE'.'ATTRIBUTE' eg. ND90.INIT.

The purpose of this field is to download attributes such as, top margin, left margin, line spacing, fonts etc. to the passbook printer. See the PRINTER.ATTRIBUTE file to determine the format of the attributes. Note when defining attributes always set up a RESET sequence to return the printer to a known state after printing.
10 Any characters
Identifies the position where the 'field' should be printed.

You can print at a position on the current line by just specifying the column, "CC" or you can print at a specific column and line, "CC,LL". The former is usually used for printing the passbook entries, whereas the latter is used for printing headings, customer details etc.
You can also specify an offset from the current line, "CC,+N" or "CC,-N". This is used when the entry line consists of two or more printed lines.
The PRINT.ON field, associated with COLUMN, will determine WHEN the data is printed.
1-9 Any characters "CC", "CC,LL", "CC,-N" or "CC,+N"
Internal field to hold process sequence and flags for passbook format.
Each multivalue represents a PRINT.ON sequence eg:
1=LINE, 2=FIRST, 3=LAST, 4=NEW, 5=END
Each subvalue represents a 'field' from the PASSBOOK.FORMAT record for that sequence. It is comprised of:
File Num-Field Num-Language-Index-Column-Line-Offset

Where File Num 0 = Free format text 1 = Special info CREDIT, DEBIT etc. 2 = ACCOUNT 3 = CUSTOMER 4 = COMPANY 5 = TRANSACTION 6 = CURRENCY 7 = ACCOUNT.STATEMENT 8 = STMT.ENTRY 9 = CATEGORY 10 = DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER And Field Num Field number from file Language Flag to show field is language field Index Multi value number in TELLER.PASSBOOK Column Position for print Line Specific line number Offset Print at current line + offset.
